Object.Name: AI models
Object.Description1: This object can provision and configure Machine Intelligence (MI) capabilities. A new MI model is provisioned using an AI Model, Model URI, and/or Model Description resources. The Input and Input labels resources can be used to configure where the model reads the input data and the Output and Output labels resource is used to configure where the model writes the output data. When the output of one model is used as input of another model, the models are chained together. Input and Output transform resources can be used to prepare data for input or to map output values, and also to transform the data before reading or writing.

Item.Name: Model
Item.Description: The binary representation of the executable model. When the executable model is written here, that is used for execution when the "Enabled" resource is set to true.

Item.Name: Version
Item.Description: The current version of the model being referred

Item.Name: Description URL
Item.Description: A URL pointing to information describing the operation executed by the function and possibly metadata related to the input and/or output.

Item.Name: Model URI
Item.Description: URL where to retrieve the model to execute or URI to identify the model to execute (and retrieved with alternative methods). When this URI is written, the device attempts to retrieve the model using the URI and stores it in the Model resource.

Item.Name: Model Integrity
Item.Description: Cryptographic checksum of the model when one is retrieved from a URI to ensure correctness and integrity of the downloaded model.

Item.Name: Model Description
Item.Description: When a model description (e.g., ONEX file) is written to this resource, the device either 1) attempts to convert that into an executable model 2) asks a third-party server to do the conversion or 3) executes the model in its native form. If conversion is done, the model is stored in the "Model" resource.

Item.Name: Inputs
Item.Description: A set of CoRE links / URLs that are pointing to resources at the device (e.g., "/3303/1/5700" for the current value of the temperature sensor instance #1) or external resources (e.g., "coap://foo.example/ac-setpoint" for setpoint of a home automation system). The output resources can be linked to other MI config objects' input resources to enable the chaining of models.

Item.Name: Input transforms
Item.Description: Description of the transformation operations for transforming the data from a local resource / external source to a format usable with the given model. Depending on the platform this may be either simple arithmetic expressions or a full program/script.

Item.Name: Input labels
Item.Description: Labels to describe which input source is connected to which input of the MI model. Label #1 matches to Input CoRE link #1, etc.

Item.Name: Outputs
Item.Description: A set of CoRE links / URLs that are pointing to resources at the device (e.g., "/3308/1/5900" for the setpoint actuator set point value of the instance #1) or external resources (e.g., "coap://foo.example/ac-setpoint" setpoint of a home automation system). The output resources can be linked to other MI config objects' input resources to enable chaining of models.

Item.Name: Output transforms
Item.Description: Transforming output from a model-specific format to a resource-specific format; similar to input transforms.

Item.Name: Output labels
Item.Description: Labels to describe which output is connected to which output of the MI model. Label #1 matches to Output CoRE link #1, etc.

Item.Name: Enabled
Item.Description: If true, the function is available to be used. If false, the model is currently inactive.

Item.Name: Condition expression
Item.Description: Expression for triggering the execution of the model. If no expression is given, the model is executed every time any input resource value changes. When condition expression is given, the values of the input resources are evaluated using the condition expression. If the expression results in a true value, the model is executed. For a false value, the model is not executed.
